rules: Rule1: Whenever the nature reserve restricts public visits access, the park project does not violate conservation rules protocol.
Rule2: If the nature reserve requires a permit for research activities, then it restricts public visits access.
Rule3: If the nature reserve is classified as a high sensitivity zone, then its area is monitored by the conservation team.

Rule4: Under the condition that the nature reserve area is monitored by the conservation team, then if the nature reserve is designated as protected by the government agency, it requires a permit for research activities.
Rule5: If the nature reserve hired a park ranger position, then the nature reserve is operational.
Rule6: Either the nature reserve hired a park ranger position or it hired a research scientist position.
Rule7: If the park ranger completed safety certification training, then the park ranger is assigned patrol routes duty.
Rule8: Either the park ranger completed safety certification training or the park ranger completed ecological monitoring training.

Rule9: Either the park ranger issued a warning to a trespasser or if the park ranger completed ecological monitoring training, then either the park ranger is assigned visitor management duty or if the nature reserve hired a research scientist position, then the nature reserve is operational.
Rule10: If the park ranger reported an unauthorized activity incident, then it is not the case that the park ranger issued a warning to a trespasser.

Rule11: Provided that the government agency updated the protected areas policy, then if the nature reserve is classified as a high sensitivity zone, then if the nature reserve is designated as protected by the government agency, it requires a permit for research activities.

Rule12: Either the government agency decreased the maintenance budget funding or if the government agency did not update the protected areas policy, then the government agency did not increase funding for conservation programs.

Rule13: Under the condition that the park project meets environmental standards regulations, then if the park project has approval from the local council, then either the park project has funding from a government grant or the nature reserve is operational.

Rule14: Provided that the park project passes the environmental impact assessment, then if the park project has approval from the local council, then either the park project has funding from a government grant or the nature reserve is operational.
Rule15: Whenever the park project completed a wildlife population survey, then the park project documented endangered species.

Rule16: Provided that the park project submitted a report to the conservation department, then either the park project meets environmental standards regulations or the park project passes the environmental impact assessment.

Rule17: If the conservation department reviewed the wildlife survey report, then if the park project documented endangered species, then the park project submitted a report to the conservation department.
Rule18: If the park ranger did not report an unauthorized activity incident, then the park ranger resolved a minor infraction issue.
Rule19: Under the condition that the government agency did not update the protected areas policy, then the government agency increased funding for conservation programs.
Rule20: If the nature reserve is not operational, then the park project violates conservation rules protocol.
facts: Fact1: The nature reserve is designated as protected by the government agency.
Fact2: The nature reserve is classified as a high sensitivity zone.
Fact3: The park project has approval from the local council.
Fact4: The park project completed a wildlife population survey.
Fact5: The conservation department reviewed the wildlife survey report.
Fact6: It is not the case that the park project has funding from a government grant.
Fact7: The park ranger is not assigned visitor management duty.
Fact8: The park ranger is not assigned patrol routes duty.
Fact9: The park ranger did not resolve a minor infraction issue.
Fact10: The government agency did not decrease the maintenance budget funding.
